People with poor vision could adapt to using alternative methods of seeing, such as magnifying lenses, reflective surfaces, or even braille technology.
They could also rely on other senses such as hearing, touch, and smell to navigate their environment.
People with poor vision could form a new community and support system, where they can share knowledge and resources to help each other cope.
They could develop new skills and adaptations, such as learning to read and write using finger tracing or developing a better sense of spatial awareness.
They could also use technology to their advantage, such as developing new apps or devices that can help them navigate and see more clearly.
